DataElement.preferredName: Follow-up Orthodontist Integer 3 Visit Month  Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The amount of time in months after the second checkup until the orthodontist wishes to check the patient again

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The amount of time after the second checkup until the orthodontist wishes to check the patient again

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.

Concepts.definition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

Property.preferredDefinition: A dentist specializing in the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of malocclusions of the teeth and their surrounding structures.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3:the act of going to see some person or place or thing for a short time.

Concepts.definition: A dentist specializing in the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of malocclusions of the teeth and their surrounding structures.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The act of going to see some person or place or thing; it can cover a short or long period but refers to a non-permanent arrangement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: PRECEDENT CRF:Practice-based Research Collaborative in Evidence-Based Dentistry Case Report Form

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar.  It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
Determining the number or amount of something.
